intro: Bulbostylis triangularis, commonly known as the triangular bulbostylis, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetland or marshy environments. The plant is characterized by its narrow, triangular-shaped leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are usually pale green or white, and it is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
